bioghist.p: Lawrence Meredith Clemson Smith (1902-1975) was a U.S. government official and Philadelphia civic leader. During the Franklin D. Roosevelt administration, he served as associate counsel for the Reconstruction Finance Corporation, as coordinator of the legal division of the National Recovery Administration, and as associate counsel investigating investment trusts for the Securities and Exchange Commission. He was the chairman of the Philadelphia Board of Trade and Conventions from 1955 to 1963 and the U.S. vice-chairman of UNESCO. He was married to Eleanor Houston Smith.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the professional and personal papers of Lawrence M. C. Smith. Materials in the collection include: correspondence primarily with family and friends; school notebooks, essays, report cards, and other materials related to Smith's education; correspondence, accounts, receipts, reports, legal documents, and certificates documenting Smith's business ventures and personal finances; correspondence, clippings, minutes, agendas and weekly reports, financial reports, and budgets documenting Smith's tenure as chairman of the Philadelphia Board of Trade and Conventions; correspondence, clippings minutes, reports, and other materials related to Smithâ€™s involvement with the Chestnut Hill Academy, the Philadelphia Fellowship Commission and the Philadelphia Housing Association among others; correspondence, clippings, pamphlets; administrative files and reports which document Smith's career as a civil servant and political activities as a private citizen; and correspondence, reports, minutes, financial records and materials related to the Schuylkill Nature Valley Center. The collection also contains photographs, postcards, a scrapbook, awards and honors, and address books.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
